contributor
  1. Nissan global data tool

    Development of a responsive, multi-lingual, mobile-first webapp for generating customised footwear based on a user’s Instagram images. The site usesoAuth, AJAX, HTML5 canvasandCSS3to deliver both the shoe generation tool and a gallery with social networking features.

  2. NIKE PHOTOiD

    Development of a responsive, multi-lingual, mobile-first webapp for generating customised footwear based on a user’s Instagram images. The site usesoAuth, AJAX, HTML5 canvasandCSS3to deliver both the shoe generation tool and a gallery with social networking features.

  3. Hotels4U.com mobile

    I was responsible for implementing the front-end for this mobile hotel booking app. Usingbackbone.js, require.js, stylusand extensive use ofCSS3the front-end provided a dynamic user experience, communicating with the search engine and checkout via aRESTfulweb service.

  4. BT Broadband usage monitor

    Usingraphael.jsand an inheritance model based on Backbone.extend I created a vector graphing library and flyweight tooltip module to display BT customers' monthly usage of their bandwidth allowance and also usedCSS3to implement the page design.

  5. Garanti financial calendar

    Working within a large existing codebase I implemented a financial transactions calendar, similar in functionality to iCal or the MS Outlook calendar. I wrote an ajax view loader and code to handle the complex repercussions of various user actions, and worked with the UX and design teams to address the many unforseen edge cases.

  6. BT Broadband status updates

    A responsive, two-page subsite for finding out if there are any reported problems affecting broadband in your area. As well as general resizing and laying out of the page for mobile the site also used a tabbed interface on desktop/tablet which became an accordion on mobile, and all achieved withCSS media queries

  7. Brandon Generator

    Brandon generator is an interactive, crowd-sourced comic built to showcase IE10's new features, built usingbackbone.js. Working in anAGILEteam I created several of the scaffolding elements of the site (e.g footer menus, taskbar notifications) that responded intelligently to user interaction with the site.

  8. Aston Martin

    Working withSASSand a large existing codebase I implemented a responsive design for several components of the site, including a video player, a configurable carousel and an online shop

  9. Saudi Aramco

    Implementation of two components for Saudi Aramco's bilingual (rtl & ltr) site

    • An interactive map, usingraphael.jsand a custom-made library to plot points in a variety of categories, filter the information shown and display information panels.tinyurl.com/aramco-map
    • A complex, multi-tiered accordion for illustrating the history of the company.tinyurl.com/aramco-history
  10. Financial Healthcheck

    This financial health diagnosic tool demanded a surprising amount of hard work to turn the non-MVC .NET generated html into an interactive and accessible application, which included a custom built validation library andWAI-ARIAroles built into each component.

author
  1. On guard

    A configurable app to call out martial art commands (like in the courtyard in 'Enter the dragon'). I wrote my ownevent emitterand loosely-coupled visualiser and control panel, and usedrequire.jsto create an app that will be easily extensible in future. The app is also covered byjasminetests (usinggruntandistanbulto run them). And, true to the ways of the ninja, there'sno-jQueryto be found

  2. wheresrhys.co.uk

    This site - you're on it now - usesCSS3, Semantic markupandno-jQuery whatsoeverto deliver my portfolio in a single extremely lightweight page. It's a subtlely responsive design too, and only requires a single http request on mobile.

  3. Sumpuzzles

    An interactive mathematical game built usingjquery, jquery-uiand a custom made library to construct the various objects needed for the game. I also architected and wrote the back-end of the site usingZend FrameworkandMySQL

  4. UK Camping Map

    My campsite search engine, usingGoogle Maps, jquery, CodeIgniterandMySQL. Among its more unique features are 3-way 'radio buttons' (yes, no and maybe), and incremental adding of points to the map as the user zooms in (most other sites opt for plotting clusters at lower zoom levels because it's a lot easier).
